CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 20, 1970, pg.18 reads: "Giving Instructions - In an effort to become more involved in helping to eradicate the evils of dope addiction which has engulfed so many young people of the area, members of the civic-minded Club 21 met recently at Ile Elegba headquarters to learn how addicts are rehabilitated. They were given instructions by Program Director Jusuf Forestier (shown right)/ He was assisted by Sala Udin Sail Salaam (Second from left) executive director, and Milton Robinson assistant director.  The girls are from left: Mrs. Shirley Smith, president; Mrs. Agnes Robinson, Mrs. Marcella T. Leftwich and Miss Mayota Hill, social chairman.  Club 21 will sponsor a benefit dance for Ile Elegba on Sept. 25 at the Roosevelt Hotel. - Harris photo."The diagram on the chalkboard reads: "Ile Elegba (Rebirth Cycle Plan Treatment (Part II Cycle-18 Months)...Part I 3-6 Months, Re-entry Part III 24 Months, Community Orientation Center C.O.C Day Care Unit D.O.C., Detox Unit Detox, 24 Hour Residential Community Rebirth From Black-Baby (Emotional) to Black Man/Woman, I week in Detox, 2 Week in D.C.U., 3 Week in ...4, 5, House of the God of the Crossroads, An Addict is a Baby He Must Learn to Grow Up and Deal With Reality."
TitMainTitle: Yusef (Jusuf Forestier) displaying chalkboard diagram of Ile Elegba drug rehabilitation program to Milton Robinson, Sala Udin (Sam Howze), Shirley Smith, Agnes McTurner Robinson, Marcella Leftwich, and Mayota Hill, members of Club 21, in Half Way Art Gallery, Centre Avenue
CatSubject_tab: Men--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Women--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Ile Elegba [House of the Crossroads] Drug Treatment Center.Chalkboards--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.
